ygData.subject: Re: Invisibility Song
ygData.msgSnippet: ...  A friend and I (I m 21st he is 18th) had to zone to Lower Guk to escape a froglok train. We were resting inside and I was using invis
ygData.messageBody:
>From: "Mott, Mike J." <MIKE.J.MOTT@...>
>Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
>To: "'eqbards@onelist.com'" <eqbards@onelist.com>
>Subject: [eqbards] Invisibility Song
>Date: Tue, 8 Jun 1999 10:09:23 -0500
>
>From: "Mott, Mike J." <MIKE.J.MOTT@...>
>
>I did some experimentation with invisibility last night at the big monolith
>on the shore in North Karana. It seems that with the song, I am also
>invisible to undead ( zombies and skellies). Of course if you have an
>unlucky moment and become visible, then they all attack.
>
>I remember reading that invisibility did not work for undead. Was this
>only
>for the mana user's version, or do higher lvl undead's see right through
>it?
>
>Mike Mott

<HELLA-SNIP-SNIP>

A friend and I (I'm 21st he is 18th) had to zone to Lower Guk to escape a
froglok train. We were resting inside and I was using invis song while he
was afk. Shortly thereafter a high-level mage had to zone a Froglof Ghoul
Knight..nasty stuff. It sat there at zone-line right in front of me for
about 3 seconds after she escaped before it started attacking my friend. Why
not me? I'm thinking maye because he is a paladin..not sure. Anyways, I am
pretty sure Shauri's Clouding is useless on higher level undead.

Sartori D'Elsiraad
Bard of Kelethin of the 21st Chorus
Veeshan
